text:
Last year IBM and Telefonica teamed up to 
create the first version of Cloud Garden,

a revolutionary platform that allows large 
enterprises and government bodies
to accelerate their digital transformation.
This was done using the latest technologies
in containers, artificial intelligence and blockchain.
Now we are bringing another partner on board
to take another major leap forward.
We are incorporating Red Hat via its OpenShift platform
which will make moving to containers an even simpler task.
Cloud Garden's future is and must be multi-cloud.

Our customers need to use the cloud that 
best matches their use cases,
which vary depending on parameters
such as security, compliance, cost, and proximity to the process.
A shift towards container environments is the only  effective way of making this transfer of loads.

It enables us to create much more 
resilient open architectures at an even lower cost.
With Cloud Garden, we take care of the platform so that you, the customers,
only have to concern yourselves with the really important aspect of the business application
to ensure effective transformation within companies.

We can do this because of the high level of 
integration with other telephone services

and, above all, because of 
integration with communications.

We are backed in this service by major 
partners such as IBM and Red Hat,

whose Cloud Pak and OpenShift technologies enable 
us to help customers take that step.

Cloud Garden is Telefonica's platform for transforming 
your applications using open architecture.
